alert.note: Alert for Cecil (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued January 08 at 3:41PM EST until January 10 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in Cecil County. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Wednesday afternoon, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 6.1 feet, flooding begins along Back Creek in Chesapeake City, Elk River near Courthouse Point, Hollywood Beach and Port Herman, and along Bohemia River near Town Point. At 6.0 feet, widespread shoreline inundation occurs near Charlestown. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides up to 6 feet above normal. Moderate tidal flooding is possible at Port Deposit, Charlestown, and Chesapeake City during the Tuesday night and Wednesday morning high tide cycles.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
